results.content: I have taken a lot of this instructor's courses, and he is a great instructor, and the course covers Firebase well. The problem is that the course is based on a prepackaged project. When creating your own project with Firebase, almost nothing shown in the course works without a lot of Googling Stack Overflow. Essentially, once you learn a concept, you need to learn (on your own) how to do it with current versions. A section on how to set up projects with Firebase, or at least which versions to target so that the concepts and code provided would work, or course appendices that highlight how to use newer Angular/Firebase/AngularFire/AngularFire-UI/whatever packages (without re-recording the course) would make it 5 stars. Unfortunately, the skills being taught in this course can't easily be applied in your own apps unless you self-learn it elsewhere.
results.content_html: I have taken a lot of this instructor's courses, and he is a great instructor, and the course covers Firebase well. The problem is that the course is based on a prepackaged project. When creating your own project with Firebase, almost nothing shown in the course works without a lot of Googling Stack Overflow. Essentially, once you learn a concept, you need to learn (on your own) how to do it with current versions. A section on how to set up projects with Firebase, or at least which versions to target so that the concepts and code provided would work, or course appendices that highlight how to use newer Angular/Firebase/AngularFire/AngularFire-UI/whatever packages (without re-recording the course) would make it 5 stars. Unfortunately, the skills being taught in this course can't easily be applied in your own apps unless you self-learn it elsewhere.

results.content: It seems this guys really knows what he's talking about, but between the accent, fast talking, switching screens without warning and very confusing source code that doesn't match the code in the video, I'm feeling pretty exhausted. Also, the instructor starts the lessons with much of what I want to learn completed. There's nothing show how to install/implement Angularfire, he just jumps to configuration. It's probably a good course if you're already familiar firebase, but if you've never touched it, it might not be for you.

results.content: I was sceptical from the beginning about quality of this course when the teacher wanted me to git clone a pre-made repo. I was thinking ... ok, here we go ; one of the boring walkthrough courses, but I'll give it a try anyways. First setup resulted in 26 vulnerabilities 20 HIGH, not a good sign! At third lesson in first section 10 min into the course, he wanted me to run a script to upload data to firestore, which resulted in error, after going to Q&A looking for an solution, I saw that many have the same error and have complain about it but the teacher didn't seem to have a solution so he gave up on trying to fix the issue. Not sure who rated this course 5 stars which resulted in me purchasing it,  if this is some kind of voting scam like on other platforms this is bad for @udemy  After going through Q&A and seeing so many issues and no solutions I highly do not recommend this cours!!!
results.content_html: I was sceptical from the beginning about quality of this course when the teacher wanted me to git clone a pre-made repo. I was thinking ... ok, here we go ; one of the boring walkthrough courses, but I'll give it a try anyways. First setup resulted in 26 vulnerabilities 20 HIGH, not a good sign! At third lesson in first section 10 min into the course, he wanted me to run a script to upload data to firestore, which resulted in error, after going to Q&A looking for an solution, I saw that many have the same error and have complain about it but the teacher didn't seem to have a solution so he gave up on trying to fix the issue. Not sure who rated this course 5 stars which resulted in me purchasing it, if this is some kind of voting scam like on other platforms this is bad for @udemy After going through Q&A and seeing so many issues and no solutions I highly do not recommend this cours!!!

results.content:
The author explained well and chose the topic very well.
However, the subtitles not only use the wrong words, but the semantic meaning can also mislead readers.
For example, now translates to not... etc. Of the ten sentences, about nine sentences are incorrect translations.
For those who listen to English, the course is really good.
For those who want to see the subtitles to understand the course, I don’t think they can.

results.content:
Trying to set up the initial project ( within the first 15 min of the course) and it die not work. 

I get only errors when running npm install. The same errors than other students reported 5 months ago.

I follow the instructions on the comments from some other students to solve the npm error, but them when I run the server I get a lot of import errors.  

I did not solve the problem,but  I continue to section 5: "Setting Up our Firestore NoSQL Database".
Follow the step, and they are more or less fine, but not up to date. 
section 5 mainly consist on running a script to upload data on the database. But that script as well fails. 
I will not continue the course.
results.content_html:
Trying to set up the initial project ( within the first 15 min of the course) and it die not work.

I get only errors when running npm install. The same errors than other students reported 5 months ago.

I follow the instructions on the comments from some other students to solve the npm error, but them when I run the server I get a lot of import errors.

I did not solve the problem,but I continue to section 5: "Setting Up our Firestore NoSQL Database".
Follow the step, and they are more or less fine, but not up to date.
section 5 mainly consist on running a script to upload data on the database. But that script as well fails.
I will not continue the course.

results.content:
This course requires that you have some prerequisite knowledge. 

You should at least know your way around the fundamental basics of the Angular framework. 

For the Firebase Cloud Functions section, you should have some basic knowledge of writing back-end functions that would run on a server, ideally using NodeJS.

This course does an excellent job in getting you familiar with the basics of the different functionalities offered by Firebase. You will reap maximum benefits from this course if you have the above prerequisites. Even if you don't, Vasco does an excellent job of welcoming a complete beginner.
results.content_html:
This course requires that you have some prerequisite knowledge.

You should at least know your way around the fundamental basics of the Angular framework.

For the Firebase Cloud Functions section, you should have some basic knowledge of writing back-end functions that would run on a server, ideally using NodeJS.

This course does an excellent job in getting you familiar with the basics of the different functionalities offered by Firebase. You will reap maximum benefits from this course if you have the above prerequisites. Even if you don't, Vasco does an excellent job of welcoming a complete beginner.

results.content: If you want to know about going serverless with Angular, this is a wonderful course that reveals the hidden treasures of such a framework and how to go about implementing your app. There is no shortage of dismantling complex logic (such as processing images and cleaning up cloud storage from uploaded files) into little understandable code snippets.
results.content_html: If you want to know about going serverless with Angular, this is a wonderful course that reveals the hidden treasures of such a framework and how to go about implementing your app. There is no shortage of dismantling complex logic (such as processing images and cleaning up cloud storage from uploaded files) into little understandable code snippets.

results.content: I was looking for a course that worked in depth with Firebase, with an agnostic front-end. This course starts with standard Firebase SDK, but shifts to AngularFire and focuses primarily on AngularFire. I would have appreciated a section devoted to Firebase SDK and a separate section to AngularFire, so I could focus on the SDK and skip the parts I don't need.
results.content_html: I was looking for a course that worked in depth with Firebase, with an agnostic front-end. This course starts with standard Firebase SDK, but shifts to AngularFire and focuses primarily on AngularFire. I would have appreciated a section devoted to Firebase SDK and a separate section to AngularFire, so I could focus on the SDK and skip the parts I don't need.

results.content:
What Vasco explains, he explains well, his talk is pleasant, and the vibe is nice but:1. The course starts with an application which is almost ready, all installations, imports and preparations are very important part of learning the subject, without them, it will be very very hard to create and use applications based on the course subjects, every small mistake can take hours. 
2. It is not practical to do such course with angular materials, because we can use in the real world a default design, no client will accept that, so many of the parts like authentication and others, I have no idea how to create without Angular Material.
3. I asked three questions, only one was answered, the other two were remain without an answer for days, so finally I delete them.
4. A lot of different syntax is used in the course, but many orders and functions are almost not explained.My understanding of many of the subject is very obscured,unfortunately, if and when I will need to use firebase, I will have to copy lines from the course code instead of fully understanding it.
results.content_html:

2. It is not practical to do such course with angular materials, because we can use in the real world a default design, no client will accept that, so many of the parts like authentication and others, I have no idea how to create without Angular Material.
3. I asked three questions, only one was answered, the other two were remain without an answer for days, so finally I delete them.
4. A lot of different syntax is used in the course, but many orders and functions are almost not explained.My understanding of many of the subject is very obscured,unfortunately, if and when I will need to use firebase, I will have to copy lines from the course code instead of fully understanding it.

results.content: Great course! I took this course parallel with an Ionic-Angular  course using Firebase (from a different teacher). I am very happy to have taken this firebase course. The approach taught in this course is much more robust and complete than the ionic course. That made my code more maintainable and easy to follow. I personally love Angular University's material!

The approach taught in this course is much more robust and complete than the ionic course. That made my code more maintainable and easy to follow. I personally love Angular University's material!

results.content:
This is a great course which covers all the major parts of Firebase. My only nitpicks would be:

- I personally hate stark white IDEs. Would love if his courses would use a dark theme, or just use VS Code with the default theme.

- Would be better if he showed the steps/code for the initial setup of AngularFire.

results.content: I would say, this course is an introduction to Firebase and Firestore. I've some other courses from Vasco, which are pretty deep but this was basic. Vasco is definitely knowledgeable and keep you engage. If you've purchased any other courses from Vasco, you probably know which project he uses. I'd suggest him to change the project and try some more complex project. Overall, I enjoyed the course and learn a lot, specially Cloud Functions section. I'd recommend this course to new bees and beginners.

results.content:
There are so many little gaps that this course has filled in for me so far. I had no idea about resolvers, first() or finalize(). I also never considered putting the id in my model as I didn't realize you could use partial objects as params.

I'm sure I'll be learning more but so far, this has been very insightful. Thank you!
